page.title: Pronouns - Indefinites
page.introduction: A final type of pronouns is indefinites. In English, these include everybody, everything, everyone, anybody, something, etc. Also, nobody, nothing, none are negative versions of the indefinite pronouns. Note that these are made up of a quantifier (positive or negative) plus an indefinite generic noun, and some languages may not merge them into a single word, as in no one for English.

radioGroup.prompt: Does your language have single-word indefinite pronouns?
radioGroup.radio: No, they are all noun phrases
Yes, like English, at least some of them are merged into indefinite pronouns
